THE PRINTER WOULD BE USED BY OUR INVESTIGATOR TO PRODUCE EVIDENCE LABELS IN THE FIELD. THIS PRINTER WOULD ALSO BE USED IN THE EVENT OF A LARGE SCALE EVENT OR INCIDENT TO PRINT TEMPORARY LABELS ON SCENE FOR PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ASSIGNMENTS.

THE AMMO CANS WOULD BE USED TO STORE EXTRA AMMUNITION AS WELL AS LESS LETHAL AMMUNITION IN THE PATROL VEHICLES. THE AMMO CANS WOULD ALSO BE USED FOR THE STORAGE OF SMALL CRIME SCENE AND EVIDENCE SUPPLIES. THE AMMO CANS WOULD PROTECT AGAINST DAMAGE AND DUST AND DIRT FREQUENTLY FOUND IN THE TRUNK AREAS OF OUR POLICE VEHICLES.

SOME OF THE CANS WILL BE USED TO STORE SMALL ARMS AMMUNITION. SEVERAL OF THE CANS WILL BE USED TO STORE GUN CLEANING SUPPLIES TO HELP ORGANIZE AND PROTECT THE SUPPLIES. WE HAVE TRAINING GUNS AND TRAINING AMMUNITION THAT NEEDS STORED AND PROTECTED THAT WILL BE PLACED IN AMMO CANS FOR THIS REASON. SOME WILL BE USED TO HELP STORE EVIDENCE SUPPLIES TO PROTECT FROM DAMAGE.

THE SHELVING WILL BE USED TO ORGANIZE AND STORE EVIDENCE. THIS SHELVING WILL REPLACE SOME OLD STORE SHELVING USED IN THE EVIDENCE ROOM THAT IS IN POOR CONDITION. THE SHELVING WILL HOLD CARDBOARD BOXES AND BINS CONTAINING EVIDENCE OF NUMEROUS SHAPES AND SIZES AND WILL HELP BETTER ORGANIZE OUR EVIDENCE ROOM.

WE WOULD USE THE PRINTER TO PRODUCE ID CARDS FOR OUR OFFICERS TO PROVIDE A BETTER AND MORE SECURE ID PROCESS. OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO BE ABLE TO HAVE THEIR IDENTIFICATION VERIFIED AND THIS PRINTER WILL PERMIT SECURITY FEATURES TO BE ADDED TO THE ID CARDS. THIS WILL KEEP US UP TO DATE WITH THE INCREASING REQUIREMENTS TO PROVIDE UPDATED MODERN ID CARDS.

THE CITY OF CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT OFTEN WORKS IN HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS THAT PRESENTS CHALLENGES WHEN KEEPING UNIFORMS CLEAN, SERVICEABLE, AND CONTAMINATE FREE.  SCENES MAY RANGE FROM MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS TO HOMICIDE SCENES THAT HAVE BIO HAZARDS THAT OFFICERS SHOULD NOT TAKE TO THEIR PRIVATE RESIDENCE TO CLEAN.  THE DRYER WILL BE USED TO ASSIST IN MAINTAINING A CLEAN UNIFORM WHEN FACED WITH CERTAIN CONTAMINATES.

THE CITY OF CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS TASKED WITH OPERATING THE FEMA SHELTER DURING INCLIMATE WEATHER.  IN ADDITION TO THIS THE DEPARTMENT DOES HAVE THE ABILITY TO HOUSE OFFICERS DURING EXTREME CONDITIONS WHEN REST IS NEEDED BUT TRAVEL TO THE RESIDENCE MAY BE LIMITED.  THE COTS WILL BE USED DURING HIGH OPERATIONAL CONDITIONS TO ALLOW PERSONNEL TO OBTAIN REST.

THE CITY OF CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT OFTEN WORKS IN HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS THAT PRESENTS CHALLENGES WHEN KEEPING UNIFORMS CLEAN, SERVICEABLE, AND CONTAMINATE FREE.  SCENES MAY RANGE FROM MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS TO HOMICIDE SCENES THAT HAVE BIO HAZARDS THAT OFFICERS SHOULD NOT TAKE TO THEIR PRIVATE RESIDENCE TO CLEAN.  THE CLOTHES WASHER WILL BE USED TO ASSIST IN MAINTAINING A CLEAN UNIFORM WHEN FACED WITH CERTAIN CONTAMINATES.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A SMALL RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT FREQUENTLY OPERATES UNDER MUTUAL AID DURING EMERGENCY CONDITIONS.  THE ABILITY TO COVER EQUIPMENT OR CONSTRUCT TEMPORARY SHELTER DURING SEVERE CLIMATE CONDITIONS IS CRITICAL TO THE DEPARTMENTS OPERATIONAL CAPABILITIES.  THE TARPS WILL BE USED TO COVER EQUIPMENT OR CONSTRUCT TEMPORARY TYPE SHELTERS WHEN NEEDED WHILE OPERATING IN SEVERE WEATHER CONDITIONS.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT OFTEN PERFORMS ITS OWN MAINTENANCE ON VEHICLES AND SUPPORTED EQUIPMENT SUCH AS GENERATORS AND TRAILERS.  THERE IS SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT ELECTRICAL CIRCUITS ON EACH PATROL VEHICLE DUE TO EMERGENCY LIGHTING AND RADIOS.  THE MULTIMETER WOULD BE USED BY THE DEPARTMENT TO MAINTAIN AND TROUBLESHOOT ITS EQUIPMENT IN LIEU OF OUTSOURCING THE WORK, WHICH WOULD PLACE A FURTHER BURDEN ON THE AGENCY.

THE CITY OF CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT OFTEN OPERATES UNDER EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AND ALSO ACTS AS THE EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER DURING EMERGENCY SITUATIONS.  THE DEPARTMENT CURRENTLY LACKS THE ABILITY TO PROVIDE TO PROVIDE SHADE OR COOLING LOCATION DURING SUMMER CONDITIONS AND WHILE OPERATING UNDER MUTUAL AID.  THE CANOPY WILL BE USED AS AN IMPROVISED SHELTER TO PROVIDE SHADE DURING SUMMER CONDITIONS.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A SMALL RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT FREQUENTLY OPERATES UNDER MUTUAL AID DURING EMERGENCY CONDITIONS.  THE ABILITY TO COVER EQUIPMENT OR CONSTRUCT TEMPORARY SHELTER DURING SEVERE CLIMATE CONDITIONS IS CRITICAL TO THE DEPARTMENTS OPERATIONAL CAPABILITIES.  THE TARPS WILL BE USED TO COVER EQUIPMENT OR CONSTRUCT TEMPORARY TYPE SHELTERS WHEN NEEDED WHILE OPERATING IN SEVERE WEATHER CONDITIONS.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A SMALL RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT IS NOT FUNDED TO UPGRADE ITS IT INFRASTRUCTURE.  THE DEPARTMENT CURRENTLY HAS NO LAPTOP COMPUTERS THAT WOULD ALLOW THE OFFICERS TO WORK REMOTELY DURING EMERGENCY OPERATIONS.  THE LAPTOPS WOULD BE USED TO FILL THE OPERATION GAP AND LOADED WITH SOFTWARE NECESSARY TO PERFORM THEIR DUTIES ONCE THE HARD DRIVE HAS BEEN INSTALLED.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A SMALL RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT IS NOT FUNDED TO PURCHASE BASIC FIRST AID EQUIPMENT.  THERE ARE NO CURRENT FIRST AID KITS IN THE PATROL VEHICLES, WHICH LEAVES BOTH THE OFFICERS AND THOSE SERVED BY THE DEPARTMENT AT RISK FOR EMERGENCY FIRST AID WHEN NEEDED.  WHEN WORKING UNDER MUTUAL AID OUTSIDE OF THE CITY, IT MAY BE AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME BEFORE EMERGENCY MEDICAL AND THE FIRST AID KITS WILL BE USED TO FILL THIS OPERATIONAL GAP.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT CURRENTLY HAS SHOTGUN PER VEHICLE BUT DOES NOT HAVE THE FUNDING FOR THE AMMO STRAP FOR THE BUTT STOCK.  THE OFFICERS CURRENTLY HOLD TWO OR THREE ROUNDS ON THEIR GUN BELT IF THEY DESIRE TO PURCHASE THE HOLDER.  THE STRAP WILL ENABLE THE OFFICER TO CARRY NEEDED ROUNDS IN AN EASILY ACCESSIBLE LOCATION FOR QUICK RETRIEVAL.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A SMALL RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT FREQUENTLY OPERATES UNDER MUTUAL AID DURING EMERGENCY CONDITIONS.  THE DEPARTMENT LACKS THE ABILITY TO TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT TO REMOTE LOCATIONS AS THERE IS NOT A TRAILER READILY AVAILABLE FOR USE DURING EMERGENCY CONDITIONS.  THE TRAILER WILL BE USED TO TRANSPORT EQUIPMENT (LIGHT SETS, GENERATORS, FUEL, ETC.) TO THE AREA WHERE LAW ENFORCEMENT ARE IN NEED.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT OFTEN PERFORMS ITS OWN MAINTENANCE ON VEHICLES AND SUPPORTED EQUIPMENT SUCH AS GENERATORS AND TRAILERS.  WE LACK THE NECESSARY TOOLS TO PERFORM MAINTENANCE AND ARE CURRENTLY WORKING ON OBTAINING TOOLS TO ASSIST IN MAINTENANCE OPERATIONS.  THE TOOLS WOULD BE USED BY THE DEPARTMENT TO MAINTAIN AND TROUBLESHOOT ITS EQUIPMENT IN LIEU OF OUTSOURCING THE WORK, WHICH WOULD PLACE A FURTHER BURDEN ON THE AGENCY.

THE CITY OF CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT IS CURRENTLY OPERATING OFF OF NEARLY SIX YEAR OLD COMPUTERS THAT ARE HAVING SIGNIFICANT OPERATIONAL ISSUES.  THE COMPUTERS WILL BE USED TO UPGRADE FOUR WORKSTATIONS TO FURTHER PROVIDE MORE UP TO DATE IT SYSTEMS AND PROVIDE MORE EFFICIENT SYSTEMS FOR OFFICERS TO USE DURING THE PERFORMANCE OF THEIR DUTIES.  DURING EMERGENCY SITUATIONS THIS BECOMES CRITICAL TO HAVE RELIABLE COMPUTER SYSTEMS TO WORK ON WITHOUT CONCERNS OF FAILURE.

THE CROCKER POLICE DEPARTMENT HAS THE ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITY OF ACTING AS THE EMERGENCY OPERATION CENTER BUT LACKS THE ABILITY TO POWER THE POLICE DEPARTMENT SHOULD WE LOSE POWER.  THE GENERATOR WILL BE UTILIZED TO POWER THE BUILDING OR POLICE ANNEX, DEPENDING ON THE SITUATION, IN ORDER TO CONTINUE OPERATIONS.

WE WILL USE STETHOSCOPES IN OUR COUNTER-DRUG OPERATIONS. STETHOSCOPES WILL BE USED BY PATROL DEPUTIES TO CHECK FOR HIDDEN COMPARTMENT PLACES, SUCH AS TIRES. ITEMS CAN BE HIDDEN IN THESE PLACES AND NORMAL SEARCHING CAN'T BE PERFORMED OF THOSE ITEMS. A INSTRUMENT SUCH AS THE STETHOSCOPE ALLOWS DEPUTY TO USE SOUND TO CHECK FOR VOIDS OR WHETHER SOMETHING THAT IS SUPPOSED TO BE VOID IS SOLID, WHICH MAY INDICATE THE PRESENCE OF HIDDEN CONTRABAND AND DRUGS.

THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE USES THE PROJECTILES IS THEIR LESS THAN LETHAL LAUNCHERS.  EXTRA PROJECTILES WILL FACILITATE ADDITIONAL TRAINING FOR OFFICERS.  LAUNCHERS ARE USED TO INCAPACITATE COMBATIVE SUBJECTS.

THE SHERBURNE COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE IS REQUESTING LATER ILLUMINATORS FOR USE ON AGENCY WEAPONS. THE LASERS AID OFFICERS IN TARGET ACQUISITION AND IDENTIFICATION. THE LASER ALLOWS AN OFFICER TO ENGAGE TARGETS WITHOUT NEEDING PROPER SIGHT ALIGNMENT. THIS IS BENEFICIAL WHEN SHOOTING WITH A GAS MASK. THE ILLUMINATOR PROVIDES A LIGHT SOURCE FOR USE WITH NIGHT VISION TO AID OFFICERS WITH TARGET IDENTIFICATION.

THE SHERBURNE COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE IS REQUESTING THERMAL IMAGES TO BE ISSUED TO PATROL OFFICERS. PATROL USES THE IMAGERS TO LOCATE SUBJECTS THAT MAY BE LOST OR SUSPECTS THAT ARE FLEEING. THERMAL DEVICES ARE PREFERRED OVER NIGHT VISION BECAUSE THEY CAN BE USED DAY AND NIGHT. THERMALS ARE ALSO CAPABLE OF SEEING SUBJECTS THAT MAY TRY TO HIDE USING CAMOUFLAGE.

THE SHERIFFS OFFICE IS REQUESTING AA LITHIUM BATTERIES FOR USE WITHIN THE SHERIFFS OFFICE. BATTERIES ARE USED TO POWER MANY DEVICES FOR ENFORCEMENT WORK. LITHIUM BATTERIES OFFER A LONGER SHELF LIFE AND LONGER RUN TIMES WHEN COMPARED TO ALKALINE BATTERIES. BATTERIES ARE ALSO A CONSUMABLE ITEM IN CONSTANT NEED.

THE SHERBURNE COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE IS WORKING TO PROVIDE EVERY PATROL OFFICER WITH A THERMAL IMAGER. THESE DEVICES HAVE PROVEN TO BE VERY BENEFICIAL WHEN LOOKING FOR SUBJECTS. PATROL HAS USED THEM TO LOCATE WANTED SUSPECTS AND LOST PERSONS AT NIGHT. THE SIGHTS ARE USED AS HAND HELD IMAGES.

THE SHERIFFS OFFICE IS REQUESTING THIS ROPE AS A RECOVERY AID FOR OUR MRAP ANE OTHER LARGE VEHICLES. THE ROPE ALLOWS A VEHICLE TO BE RECOVERED WITHOUT PUTTING UNNECESSARY STRESS ON ANY VEHICLE. THE ROPE STRETCHES TO ABSORB ANY IMPACT ASSOCIATED WITH PULLING A STUCK VEHICLE.  THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE FREQUENTLY TRAINS AT CAMP RIPLEY WHICH HAS NUMEROUS UNIMPROVED ROADS IN AND AROUND TRAINING SITES.

THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE IS REQUESTING HEADSETS FOR USE BY THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE UNIT AND PATROL.  THE HEADSETS WILL PROVIDE NECESSARY HEARING PROTECTION WHILE ON THE FIREARMS RANGE AND DURING TRAINING.  THE BENEFIT TO THIS STYLE IS THAT RADIO COMMUNICATIONS CAN BE TRANSMITTED THROUGH THE HEADSET.  THIS PROVIDES CLEAR COMMUNICATION BETWEEN INSTRUCTORS AND OFFICERS ON THE RANGE INCREASING SAFETY FOR ALL.

THE SHERIFFS OFFICE IS REQUESTING LUMINOUS TAPE FOR MARKING HAZARDS IN AREAS THAT ARE FREQUENTED IN LOW LIGHT.  THE TAPE WILL IDENTIFY CORNERS AND STEPS TO REDUCE INJURY TO OFFICERS.  TAPE CAN ALSO BE USED ON VEHICLES TO MARK INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR AREAS TO MAINTAIN HIGH VISIBILITY.

THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE HAS CONTACTED DS COLORADO SPRINGS TO OBTAIN PHOTOS AND VERIFY ITEMS APPEAR SERVICEABLE.  THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE IS REQUESTING NIGHT VISION FOR USE BY SEVERAL DIVISIONS.  PATROL AND INVESTIGATIONS CAN USE THE DEVICES WHEN CONDUCTING INVESTIGATIONS AND SURVEILLANCE AT NIGHT.  DEVICES MAY ALSO BE USED FOR SEARCH AND RESCUE.

THE SHERBURNE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE IS REQUESTING TASER TRAINING CARTRIDGES FOR TRAINING PURPOSES.  THE CARTRIDGES ARE SINGLE USE AND WILL ALLOW OFFICERS TO PRACTICE LIVE TASER DEPLOYMENTS WITH THE SAFETY OF A NON CONDUCTIVE CARTRIDGE.  CARTRIDGES WILL ALSO BE USED DURING ANNUAL QUALIFICATIONS.

THESE VEHICLES WOULD BE USED BY PAT HARRISON WATERWAY DISTRICT LAW ENFORCEMENT DIVISION OFFICERS. THESE VEHICLES WOULD MAKE THESE TASK MUCH MORE EFFICIENT  AND ALLOW US TO BE FIRST ON SCENE IN RENDERING AID TO OUR EMPLOYEES OR PUBLIC THAT WE SERVE.
